topic.title: ZeroNet on a VPS
topic.body:
Is it possible to run ZeroNet on a VPS?

I have tried on Ubuntu 16.04 Server, but as soon as I close the ssh session terminal window ZeroNet stops working.

8_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ.body:
I always use Tor and it's working very fast no matter how many sites I have. Even when I click on "Update all sites" there are no problems.

Your internet connection, the Great Firewall of China or your computer may cause your issues.

> [p2p](#comment_202_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): are you sure under Tor always mode? if so, ZeroHello should says TOR: ALWAYS at the top of page.

Yes, it says "TOR: ALWAYS".

Actually, Tor is the only way for me to connect because I have added a file named zeronet.conf with the following content:
[global]
tor = always

No Tor = No ZeroNet P2P connections because of this file.

> "We invite you to train for combat and learn how to build and detonate improvised explosives" a chilling message on the front page of a new **Zeronet portal** observed by The Foreign Desk said.

> "If you cannot migrate from the land of the infidels to the Caliphate, then carrying out jihad in your own country will also be a victory for the Islamic State and all Muslims," the message read.

> The website appeared on the **ZeroNet network**, a serverless peer-to-peer group of websites that rely on bitcoin cryptography and the BitTorrent network. These websites, though encrypted, making simple detection challenging for authorities, are accessible via a regular web browser.
